column3:
Have you run through the gitian guide and checked it doesn't need any
changes for 8.2?

On Friday, September 11, 2015, unsystemizer notifications@github.com
wrote:

> - Link to Debian 8.1 netinstall ISO is dead, changed to valid 8.2
> - Changed checksum to 8.2 netinstall ISO checksum (
>   http://cdimage.debian.org/debian-cd/8.2.0/amd64/iso-cd/SHA256SUMS)
> - Verified CD checksum, checksu

- I submitted a PR before making sure of that because the page says that any newer minor version should do as well. 
- The instructions are buggy, so I haven't yet managed to complete the process (I got to the point where I'm supposed to build Bitcoin Core binaries). It seems the instructions should be fixed/changed in any case. 

I'll confirm once I manage to complete the procedure using Deb 8
If you've found a problem with the guide please open an issue so it can be looked at.\n
Right, I'm going to do that as I make progress understanding the process. The guide is quite comprehensive (KVM, LXC, VirtualBox, etc.) so I hope to make another PR at a later time.\n
Great. Once you do get up and running, sigs are always welcome at https://github.com/bitcoin/gitian.sigs\n
Tested ACK once nits addressed. I've run through the guide and built all sigs with 8.2\n
@MarcoFalke what typo nits? It looks ok to me at first glance.\n
@unsystemizer  @btcdrak https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6661/files#r39330329 The link is updated but the text is not (still says 8.1)\n
Was taking too long, I updated the version number and merged via 551d7ed\n
If these are available via https, then please let's use that.\n
Agreed,  however https://www.debian.org/CD/ seems to stipulate that you cannot download these over `HTTPS`.\nWhich is probably why we have a SHA256 below.\n
@Diapolo I have confirmed https is not available.\n
